description: From Middle English wyndowed, wyndowid, equivalent to window +‎ -ed.

entries.meaning: Fitted with windows, often of a particular kind or, in (heraldry), of a specified colour.
examples: You must have seen a strange windowed house near Hyde-Park, which is so built that no one can look out of any of the apartments  […]

entries.meaning: (computing, graphical user interface) Occupying only a part of the screen (in a window.)
examples: This game can be played both in windowed mode and in full-screen mode.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of window
